oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Court case involving McClung slaves freed to emigrate to Liberia
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In his will, William McClung of Blount County has freed his slave Hannah and her children and provided $50 apiece to enable them to emigrate to west coast of Africa or Liberia. This case is being adjudicated in Monroe County chancery court. According to a "next friend" petitioner acting on behalf of the slaves, McClung's executors have refused to carry out the provisions of his will, and their solicitor is asking relief from the court.
